data.title: The 30+ Best Patrick Swayze Movies
data.meta_description: Over 1K filmgoers have voted on the 30+ Best Patrick Swayze Movies. Current Top 3: Road House, Point Break, The Outsiders
data.text:
Ranked By

6.4K votes

1.3K voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

With nearly 1,300 movie fans casting their votes, this list of the best Patrick Swayze movies is sure to please fans of the late actor's work. After his breakout role in 1987's Dirty Dancing, Patrick Swayze became an instant heartthrob and one of Hollywoodâ€™s most beloved leading men for decades afterward.

Swayze was a masterful chameleon who could seamlessly inhabit characters from all walks of life - from a romantic hero in Ghost to a tough-as-nails bouncer in Road House and even a drag queen dancer in To Wong Foo Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar. He imbued each character with humor, vulnerability, and his trademark charisma that made him both lovable and unforgettable.

From classic films like Point Break or Donnie Darko to lesser-known gems like Jump!, here are some of the best Patrick Swayze movies that prove why he remains an enduring star today. So why not check out the list now? Vote up your favorites on this ranking and celebrate one of cinema's greatest actors.

Most divisive: Powder Blue

Over 1.3K Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 30+ Best Patrick Swayze Movies

1

Patrick Swayze, Kelly Lynch, Sam Elliott

Released : 1989

Directed by : Rowdy Herrington

As a testament to Patrick Swayze's versatile acting skills, Road House showcases his ability to assume the role of an action hero with ease. In this adrenaline-fueled movie, Swayze stars as Dalton, a bouncer hired to restore order in a chaotic bar. His presence alone ignites conflict and ultimately leads to explosive encounters with ruthless adversaries. With its gritty setting and well-crafted fight scenes, Road House exemplifies not only Swayze's signature charm but also his remarkable prowess as an action star.

Available On:

subscription

$14.99

$2.99

2

Patrick Swayze, Keanu Reeves, Gary Busey

Released : 1991

Directed by : Kathryn Bigelow

In Point Break, Patrick Swayze takes on the role of Bodhi, the enigmatic leader of a group of adrenaline-seeking bank robbers who don disguises inspired by former U.S. Presidents. As FBI agent Johnny Utah (played by Keanu Reeves) infiltrates their ranks, an intense game of cat-and-mouse ensues fueled by high-speed chases, daring stunts, and thrilling waves. This action-packed adventure film highlights Swayze's charismatic performance as a captivating antihero that keeps viewers hooked until the very end.

3

Matt Dillon, C. Thomas Howell, Ralph Macchio

Released : 1983

Directed by : Francis Ford Coppola

Patrick Swayze delivers a poignant performance in Francis Ford Coppola's adaptation of S.E. Hinton's coming-of-age novel The Outsiders. Set against the backdrop of 1960s Oklahoma, this emotionally charged drama explores class division and camaraderie between members of rival gangs â€“ the working-class Greasers and affluent Socs. As Darry Curtis, the stoic older brother striving to keep his family together amidst turmoil, Swayze demonstrates his ability to convey depth and complexity within his character while sharing screen time with other notable young actors like Tom Cruise and Rob Lowe.

Available On:

$4.99

$3.99

Jennifer Grey, Patrick Swayze, Jerry Orbach

Released : 1987

Directed by : Emile Ardolino

Inarguably one of Patrick Swayze's most beloved films, Dirty Dancing epitomizes the romantic-drama genre with its impassioned dance numbers and timeless love story. Swayze shines as Johnny Castle, a skilled dance instructor who becomes entangled in a passionate affair with Baby (played by Jennifer Grey), the sheltered daughter of affluent vacationers at a Catskills resort. The undeniable chemistry between Swayze and Grey, paired with iconic moments such as the climactic lift scene, elevates Dirty Dancing to classic status and solidified Swayze's place in cinematic history.

Available On:

$3.99

$4.99

$3.99

Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Whoopi Goldberg

Released : 1990

Directed by : Jerry Zucker

With Ghost, Patrick Swayze brought an otherworldly tale of love and loss to life through his portrayal of Sam Wheat, a recently deceased man seeking to protect his grieving fiancÃ©e from beyond the grave. This supernatural romance deftly balances tender emotion with suspenseful intrigue, resulting in an enthralling cinematic experience that captured the hearts of audiences worldwide. Bolstered by powerful performances from co-stars Demi Moore and Whoopi Goldberg, this poignant film remains one of Swayze's most enduring legacies.

6

Patrick Swayze, C. Thomas Howell, Lea Thompson

Released : 1984

Directed by : John Milius

In Red Dawn, Patrick Swayze leads a band of young rebels in their valiant fight against foreign invaders occupying American soil. As Jed Eckert, an experienced hunter-turned-guerrilla fighter, Swayze expertly conveys unwavering determination and courage amidst harrowing circumstances. This action-packed war film showcases both Swayze's physical prowess and dramatic skill in equal measure while providing compelling insight into themes of patriotism and resilience.
